oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Dickey Lee interview - Joe Suglia - 1976-02-12 - WBUK
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with Dickey Lee (performer/songwriter), conducted by Joe Suglia on February 12, 1976 on radio station WBUK.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Dickey Lee introduction -- Dickey Lee promotes Joe Suglia and WBUK -- Joe Suglia introduces Dickey Lee -- Lee talks about his latest single, Rocky -- Dickey Lee talks about Put Me Down Softly -- Lee talks about Angel, Roses, And Rain -- Lee talks about I Saw My Lady -- Lee talks about being a versatile singer, not restricted to genre -- Lee talks about The Busiest Memory In Town, and how it is his only beer drinking song -- Lee talks about Never Ending Song Of Love -- Lee talks about She Thinks I Still Care -- Lee talks about his songwriting process -- Lee talks about Sparkling Brown Eyes -- Lee talks about Ashes Of Love -- Lee talks about his future ideas -- Lee talks about Darcy Farrow and Tennessee Blues -- Joe Suglia thanks Lee and concludes the interview
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Lee, Dickey;
